name: Ngspice
description: Open source SPICE circuit simulator.

name: LTSpice
description: The industry standard free SPICE circuit simulator from Linear Technologies.

name: Octopart
description: Probably the most well known part search engine.

name: Findchips
description: Part search from Supply Frame.

name: Parts.io
description: Another search engine from Supply Frame geared towards discovering new parts.

name: Tracespace Viewer
description: Gerber viewer that lets you inspect the individual layers as well as the board preview.

name: Gerblook
description: Online Gerber viewer powered by Gerbv.

name: Mayhew Labs 3dpcb
description: 3D Gerber viewer.

name: EasyEDA Gerber Viewer
description: Gerber viewer and design for manufacture test.

name: Gerbv
description: Excellent Gerber viewer for Linux and BSD.

name: KiCAD Gerbview
description: The KiCAD gerber viewer.

name: Eyrie.io
description: For viewing Eagle and KiCAD designs online.

name: Hackaday.io
description: Social site for sharing projects from the popular blog.

name: Kitnic.it
description: Project sharing site that helps you buy parts and re-build projects. Open source and developed by yours truly.

name: KiCAD
description: Open source EDA package with push and shove router, differential pairs and much more.

name: Eagle
description: One of the most popular EDA packages due to it's (board size restricted) free version.

name: Design Spark PCB
description: Gratis EDA package without restrictions, sponserd by RS Components.

name: Altium Circuit Maker
description: Free package from the maker of the go to pro software.

name: gEDA
description: Another open source package, good for people that like scripting and makefiles, Linux and BSD only.

name: Xesscorp's list of KiCAD 3rd part tools
Contextual Electronics' KiCAD 4.0 video tutorials
description: Comprehensive video tutorials for beginners.

name: KiCAD.info forums
description: User discussion and help forum.

name: Keyboard PCB Guide
description: Comprehensive written tutorial that takes you through creating a keyboard PCB.

name: List of ULPs everyone should know
PcbShopper
description: Comparison service for quite a lot of different PCB batching and assembly services

name: OshPark
description: Low cost PCB batching service with high quality boards with a signature purple silkscreen.

name: DirtyPcbs
description: Low cost PCB batching service that prides itself on it's "dirty" quality

name: Hackaday
description: Probably the most popular blog covering electronics and hardware hacking.

name: bunniestudios.com
description: Andrew 'Bunnie' Huang covers hardware hacking, open hardware, manufacturing and more.

name: EEVBlog forum
description: Probably the largest and most active forum to discuss electronic engineering topics.

name: /r/electronics and /r/ECE are the two most active sub-reddits for EE topics.
/r/askelectronics
description: Sub-reddit dedicated to help on electronics topics.

name: Electronics Stack Exchange
description: Question and answer site for electronics running on the popular Stack Overflow service.

name: EEVBlog beginners forum
description: Good place for beginner questions, other sub-forums on EEVblog should be suitable for questions on more advanced topics.

name: The Amp Hour
description: Off-the-cuff chat about electronics with Chris Gammel and Dave Jones (EEVBlog), often with guests

name: Embedded FM
description: Christopher and Elecia White discuss embedded systems development and much more, often with guests

name: Sparkgap Podcast
description: Covers a specific EE topic each episode, sometimes with guests.

name: EEVblog
description: One of the earliest and most successful YouTube channels where Dave Jones does teardowns, tutorials and more.

name: ElectroBOOM
description: YouTube channel that debunks and explains EE topics with a lot of comedy thrown in.

name: Micah Scott
description: Video logs of reverse engineering and re-purposing consumer electronics hardware in creative ways.

name: Afrotechmods
description: Tutorials on electronics projects, often suitable for beginners as well.

name: The Signal Path
description: Very in depth teardowns, repairs and reviews of lab equipment and prototyping products.

name: w2aew
description: Excellent tutorials about basic and complex analog hardware.

name: Mr. Carlson's Lab
description: Teardowns, repairs and restorations with an emphasis on classic electronics gear.

name: All About Circuits
description: Online textbook for learning theory with clear diagrams and explanations.
